Requirement: Purpose specification: State the specific purposes for which data will be shared/processed.
Why it matters (short rationale): Purpose anchors lawfulness, minimisation and proportionality.

Requirement: Legal basis: Identify a lawful basis (and any additional conditions for special-category data).
Why it matters (short rationale): Required to share lawfully and demonstrate accountability.

Requirement: Parties and roles: Name all parties and define roles (controller/processor/joint controller/recipient) and responsibilities.
Why it matters (short rationale): Clarifies obligations and liabilities between organisations.

Requirement: Data categories & scope: List personal/non-personal data categories, granularity, and identifiers to be shared.
Why it matters (short rationale): Enables data minimisation and proportionality checks.

Requirement: Law enforcement / special regimes (if applicable): Declare when Part 3 (law enforcement) or other regimes apply.
Why it matters (short rationale): Ensures correct legal framework and safeguards.

Requirement: Security measures (TOMs): Describe technical/organisational measures for transfer, storage, and access.
Why it matters (short rationale): Protects confidentiality, integrity, availability; builds trust.

Requirement: Access control & authentication: Define who can access what, under what conditions, with audit trails.
Why it matters (short rationale): Prevents unauthorised use and supports accountability.

Requirement: Retention & deletion: Specify retention periods, review cycles, and secure deletion/return procedures.
Why it matters (short rationale): Limits risk, aligns with storage limitation principle.

Requirement: International transfers: Identify destinations and transfer mechanisms; describe additional safeguards.
Why it matters (short rationale): Required for cross-border flows and interoperability.

Requirement: Data subject rights handling: Explain how access, rectification, erasure, objection, restriction, and portability will be met across parties.
Why it matters (short rationale): Demonstrates rights enablement and fair processing.

Requirement: Transparency & notices: Explain what information is provided to individuals and by whom (incl. indirect collection).
Why it matters (short rationale): Underpins fairness and public trust.

Requirement: Risk assessment triggers: Indicate when DPIA/TRA is required and how outcomes constrain sharing.
Why it matters (short rationale): Makes risk-based governance explicit.

Requirement: Data quality & accuracy assurances: Define responsibilities for data quality, versioning, and correction propagation.
Why it matters (short rationale): Reduces harm from inaccurate or stale data.

Requirement: Standards & formats: Specify schemas/standards, metadata, and interoperability requirements.
Why it matters (short rationale): Facilitates responsible, efficient re-use and portability.

Requirement: Permitted/Prohibited uses & onward sharing: Define allowed purposes, secondary use conditions, and onward disclosure controls.
Why it matters (short rationale): Prevents scope creep; enforces purpose limitation.

Requirement: Breach & incident response: Establish reporting lines, timelines, cooperation duties, and remediation steps.
Why it matters (short rationale): Ensures coordinated response and legal compliance.

Requirement: Monitoring, audit & review: Plan review frequency, audit rights, metrics, and triggers (complaints, breaches, changes).
Why it matters (short rationale): Operationalises accountability and continuous improvement.

Requirement: Governance & decision records: Maintain DSA approvals, change logs, and sharing decision forms.
Why it matters (short rationale): Provides evidence for regulators and auditors.

Requirement: Children & vulnerable groups (where relevant): Include best-interests tests and enhanced safeguards.
Why it matters (short rationale): Addresses heightened risks and fairness.

Requirement: Termination & exit: Define triggers, wind-down, data return/deletion, and continued obligations.
Why it matters (short rationale): Reduces residual risk after sharing ends.
